description: Wine 10.0 is working its way toward a stable release likely in the next week or two, but today there is Wine 10.0-rc5 with the latest round of fixes...
title: Wine 10.0-rc5 Brings Another 31 Bug Fixes

description: Google engineers and others have been talking about Address Space Isolation "ASI" for the Linux kernel to better deal with speculative execution attacks and other CPU vulnerabilities. Last summer there were some new "request for comments" patches working on Linux Address Space Isolation and today a second iteration of those RFC patches were published. They are now out for review but they are unlikely to see much use: the I/O throughput as measured by FIO takes a 70% hit...
title: Experimental Linux Address Space Isolation "ASI" v2 Patches: I/O Throughput Lower By 70%

description: Git 2.48 is out today as the newest feature update to this leading distributed version control system...
title: Git 2.48 Released With Initial Support For The Meson Build System

description: Squeezing into the mainline Linux 6.13 kernel code today as part of the latest batch of "fixes" are two additional enablement bits for the upcoming high-density Intel Xeon Clearwater Forest server processors...
title: More Intel Xeon Clearwater Forest Enablement Merged For Linux 6.13

description: A change made to the Linux kernel in June 2023 has led to a situation where PCIe Gen5 NVMe solid state drives could potentially drop down to Gen1 speeds... Lenovo engineers spotted this issue and bisected the problem along with coming up with a solution...
title: Lenovo Discovers Situation Of Linux Dropping PCIe Gen 5 NVMe SSDs To Gen 1 Speeds

description: The Servo open-source web browser layout engine project has published their newest monthly recap to highlight the progress they made during December 2024. They ended the year on a high note with getting dark mode support working and other features wired up -- including enough to now be able to read Discord messages but not yet enough to actually post messages on Discord...
title: Servo Browser Engine Adds Dark Mode, Some XPath Support

description: Hans-Kristian Arntzen  with Valve has just released VKD3D-Proton 2.14.1 as this Direct3D 12 over Vulkan implementation...
title: VKD3D-Proton 2.14.1 Brings A Few Fixes For Direct3D 12 On Vulkan

description: Ubuntu developers are looking at extending their policy of not releasing stable release updates (SRUs) around the weekend as well as not phasing them up to 100% during those weekend times either...
title: Ubuntu Considers Taking It Easier On Software Updates Over Weekends

description: The Intel Haswell CPUs were originally introduced back in 2013 and great for the time. Under Microsoft Windows the driver support has long been obsolete but under Linux with Intel's open-source driver support there is still even the occasional fix all these years later. Coming up for the Linux 6.14 kernel cycle in 2025 is a fix to benefit Haswell and similarly aged Intel platforms with integrated graphics...
title: 12 Years After Haswell, Intel Open-Source Graphics Developers Still Make Occasional Fix

description: Mike Blumenkrantz of Valve's Linux graphics driver team who is known for his work on the Zink generic OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver implementation has made another mighty round of improvements for helping the gaming performance...
title: Blumenkrantz Boosts Zink Performance By 150% For Everspace, Possibly Helping Other Games
